channel.title: Behind the Scenes May
channel.description:
May promises a couple new updates that look actually pretty awesome, what's your thought? You can read all the updates [url=http://services.runescape.com/m=news/behind-the-scenes---may]here[/url]
One of the more major updates that caught my eye was one of the new bosses, [i]The Queen Black Dragon[/i] that's apparently 5 times bigger than the King Black Dragon and drops a Dragon Kiteshield. [img]http://services.runescape.com/m=rswikiimages/en/2012/5/qbdhead_thumb-01114154.png[/img]

item.title: Behind the Scenes May
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2

what in the fuck you can get tattoos now
[/quote]
tattoos, horns, katanas, etc.
Although I’ve yet to actually see someone with one of the three…[/quote]katana’s were from runescape cards a while back, not from the SOF afaik…

EDIT - Nevermind, different katana

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the Scenes May
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

why am I the only one that has never had an FPS issue and I have some shitty laptop.

It depends on the extent of the shittyness of your laptop

Mine has many problems but the most damaging to my fps in game is the inability to cool itself due to it ventilating horribly… :L

Read full topic

@kronixz wrote:

This is going to be fun

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the Scenes May
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:29, topic:441117”][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=543793.msg3986716#msg3986716 date=1335982478]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=543793.msg3986713#msg3986713 date=1335981893]

I honestly like the look of this, update wise. The advertising ploy is pretty obvious with ‘mad may’, but the actual updates seem pretty cool. To me it sounds like they are trying to fix the community, with clans and then this group rc training location and now these ‘bonfires’, and I really hope it works. The community is what made the game no longer fun if you ask me (example - house parties are virtually non-existent now )

I’ve come to the conclusion they’ve given up on trying to bring back the old players so there now attempting to attract other mmo players.
I wonder when they will convert to c++?

Do you really think that redoing the whole thing in C++ is going to attract people? If anything, it would piss off the members who like the convenience of applets.

Obviously the majority of players wouldn’t even notice a difference because there 12.
I’m insinuating that there going to have to change the language it’s programmed in to support the updates there implementing.
[/quote]Except they don’t, you simply don’t have a clue what you are talking about.

OH YEAH BECAUSE THE GAME IS REALLY HOLDING UP REAL WELL RIGHT NOW AMIRIGHT?
In the future, not anytime soon however I suspect they’ll probably convert. Java wasn’t made to support what there trying to do anyways, and what do you mean “except they don’t”?

They don’t have to use C++ I’m just saying I don’t think it will be a java based game forever.
[/quote]I really really reallllllyy hope you’re trolling

Lol @ thinking Java can’t handle it. If your computer is decent, RuneScape runs fine.

Educate yourself’s.
It’s becoming increasingly obvious that there’s problems with lagg because of the language it’s written in, at the rate there developing and upgrading they’ll have to convert or the majority of players won’t even be able to play the game. [/quote]Lol, update today:

Performance

As many of you will be aware, some our previous anti-bot initiatives caused an adverse affect on the frame rate and performance of the game. The Game Engine Team has been working very hard on solutions to this and the update should bring significant increases in overall playability for the vast majority of those affected, noticeably more so on lower-spec computers.


Educate yourself

Read full topic

I guess shitty comps dominate when it comes to fps

item.title: Behind the Scenes May
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:29, topic:441117”][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=543793.msg3986716#msg3986716 date=1335982478]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=543793.msg3986713#msg3986713 date=1335981893]

I honestly like the look of this, update wise. The advertising ploy is pretty obvious with ‘mad may’, but the actual updates seem pretty cool. To me it sounds like they are trying to fix the community, with clans and then this group rc training location and now these ‘bonfires’, and I really hope it works. The community is what made the game no longer fun if you ask me (example - house parties are virtually non-existent now )

I’ve come to the conclusion they’ve given up on trying to bring back the old players so there now attempting to attract other mmo players.
I wonder when they will convert to c++?

Do you really think that redoing the whole thing in C++ is going to attract people? If anything, it would piss off the members who like the convenience of applets.

Obviously the majority of players wouldn’t even notice a difference because there 12.
I’m insinuating that there going to have to change the language it’s programmed in to support the updates there implementing.
[/quote]Except they don’t, you simply don’t have a clue what you are talking about.

OH YEAH BECAUSE THE GAME IS REALLY HOLDING UP REAL WELL RIGHT NOW AMIRIGHT?
In the future, not anytime soon however I suspect they’ll probably convert. Java wasn’t made to support what there trying to do anyways, and what do you mean “except they don’t”?

They don’t have to use C++ I’m just saying I don’t think it will be a java based game forever.
[/quote]I really really reallllllyy hope you’re trolling

Lol @ thinking Java can’t handle it. If your computer is decent, RuneScape runs fine.

Educate yourself’s.
It’s becoming increasingly obvious that there’s problems with lagg because of the language it’s written in, at the rate there developing and upgrading they’ll have to convert or the majority of players won’t even be able to play the game. [/quote]And the lag issue has nothing to do with Java whatsoever. The are doing the only thing they can do to actively combat bots: Aggressive obfuscation. The exact same thing would happen to ANY other game regardless of the language it is written in. Jagex chose this trade-off, and i believe it was the right thing to do.

Read full topic

ye ur retarded acorn lol

item.title: Behind the Scenes May
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

And if they switch languages a lot of their players wouldn’t play the game either. Not that I agree with your assumptions that it’s the language that causes the issues, but you don’t realize that a lot of the what makes runescape popular is that it’s a cross-platform browser game.

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the Scenes May
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“dain bramage, post:28, topic:441117”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=543793.msg3986713#msg3986713 date=1335981893]

[quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=543793.msg3986697#msg3986697 date=1335980574]

I honestly like the look of this, update wise. The advertising ploy is pretty obvious with ‘mad may’, but the actual updates seem pretty cool. To me it sounds like they are trying to fix the community, with clans and then this group rc training location and now these ‘bonfires’, and I really hope it works. The community is what made the game no longer fun if you ask me (example - house parties are virtually non-existent now )

I’ve come to the conclusion they’ve given up on trying to bring back the old players so there now attempting to attract other mmo players.
I wonder when they will convert to c++?

Do you really think that redoing the whole thing in C++ is going to attract people? If anything, it would piss off the members who like the convenience of applets.

Obviously the majority of players wouldn’t even notice a difference because there 12.
I’m insinuating that there going to have to change the language it’s programmed in to support the updates there implementing.
[/quote]Except they don’t, you simply don’t have a clue what you are talking about.

OH YEAH BECAUSE THE GAME IS REALLY HOLDING UP REAL WELL RIGHT NOW AMIRIGHT?
In the future, not anytime soon however I suspect they’ll probably convert. Java wasn’t made to support what there trying to do anyways, and what do you mean “except they don’t”?

They don’t have to use C++ I’m just saying I don’t think it will be a java based game forever.
[/quote]I really really reallllllyy hope you’re trolling

Lol @ thinking Java can’t handle it. If your computer is decent, RuneScape runs fine.[/quote]
Educate yourself’s.
It’s becoming increasingly obvious that there’s problems with lagg because of the language it’s written in, at the rate there developing and upgrading they’ll have to convert or the majority of players won’t even be able to play the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the Scenes May
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:22, topic:441117”][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=543793.msg3986681#msg3986681 date=1335979915]

I honestly like the look of this, update wise. The advertising ploy is pretty obvious with ‘mad may’, but the actual updates seem pretty cool. To me it sounds like they are trying to fix the community, with clans and then this group rc training location and now these ‘bonfires’, and I really hope it works. The community is what made the game no longer fun if you ask me (example - house parties are virtually non-existent now )

I’ve come to the conclusion they’ve given up on trying to bring back the old players so there now attempting to attract other mmo players.
I wonder when they will convert to c++?

Do you really think that redoing the whole thing in C++ is going to attract people? If anything, it would piss off the members who like the convenience of applets.

Obviously the majority of players wouldn’t even notice a difference because there 12.
I’m insinuating that there going to have to change the language it’s programmed in to support the updates there implementing.
[/quote]Except they don’t, you simply don’t have a clue what you are talking about.[/quote]
OH YEAH BECAUSE THE GAME IS REALLY HOLDING UP REAL WELL RIGHT NOW AMIRIGHT?
In the future, not anytime soon however I suspect they’ll probably convert. Java wasn’t made to support what there trying to do anyways, and what do you mean “except they don’t”?

They don’t have to use C++ I’m just saying I don’t think it will be a java based game forever.

Read full topic
